results.title: Living tomorrow. No. 124
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: A new mini tape-recorder, designed to record scientific information, helps patients undergoing tests for heart disease; five simple components are all that’s necessary to assemble one of the tiniest synchronous electric motors in the world; backache is frequently the result of taking life sitting down, and since most sufferers are unlikely to revert to a quadruped existence, a cushion has been designed to support our sagging systems.

results.title: Living things are everywhere
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Uses the story of a young boy’s discovery of the variety of living things to be found along a river bank and in the woods to explain that living things may be discovered almost anywhere and to stimulate interest in the study of plant and animal relationships.

results.title: Living stone
results.creator_credit: John Feeney, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film shows the inspiration, often related to belief in the supernatural, behind Inuit sculpture. The Inuit’s approach to the work is to release the image he sees imprisoned in the rough stone. The film centres on an old legend about the carving of the image of a sea spirit to bring food to a hungry camp. Photographed at Cape Dorset, Boffin Island with Inuit stone carvers of Kingait and Kangiyak. Award winning documentary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Feeney, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Living filter
results.creator_credit: Hornbein-Wood Films and Pennsylvania State University
results.brief_description: Describes an experiment in which municipal waste water was used to irrigate forest and farmland, thereby increasing plant growth and purifying the water to drinking quality. The experiment also suggests the potential use of the technique in reclaiming strip-mined land.

results.title: Living dangerously
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Recommends precautions against bush fires in outer-suburban and rural areas. Common fire hazards on suburban properties include undergrowth and scrub on fences, overhanging trees, cluttered spoutings, absence of fly wire on doors and windows to prevent entry of sparks; absence of incinerators and compost heaps to dispose of rubbish. In rural areas the responsibility of the inidividual is greater. The film shows examples of bad fire hazards; crops growing close to buildings; absence of fire breaks; litter strewn over properties. Stresses the need to check spark arrestors on machinery and to maintain fire fighting gear in working condition. In one year, bush fires cost the country fourteen million pounds, a loss which could have been avoided by people being wise before the event. Photography by Frank Bagnall.

results.title: The Living city
results.creator_credit: John Barnes, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Twentieth Century Fund
results.brief_description: Surveys the need for redevelopment of American cities and the forces which have created problems in urban areas; describes obstacles which deter the elimination of blighted areas and tenements and the relief of traffic congestion. Includes scenes of St Louis in 1890, and of present-day housing and building programs in Baltimore, Philadelphia and Pittsburgh.

results.title: The Little ships of England
results.brief_description: A study of boatbuilding in Britain, tracing the processes of the industry from the oak, ash, and elm forests, to the boat and shipbuilding yards. The film includes a sequence dealing with the part played by little ships in the evacuation of Dunkirk, World War II.

results.title: A Little fable
results.brief_description: An intriguing animated film in which symbolic representation is used instead of realistic drawings. It tells the story of Charlie, an orange boy, whose blue friend is rejected by his mother. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The little chimney sweep
results.creator_credit: Lotte Reiniger, Louis Hagen, Richard Kaplan and Primrose Productions
results.brief_description: An example of Lotte Reiniger’s early silhouette films, re-cut and given a new sountrack. Tells the tale of a little chimney sweep from 18th century London who comes down the wrong chimney and meets a rich young heiress.

production_dates.notes: Re-edited from the original version produced in 1935

results.title: Liszt and his music
results.brief_description: The life of Franz Liszt, as musical composer, performer and teacher presented against a background of the European capitals where he composed and performed. Includes excerpts from the following works: Concerto No. 1 in E Flat Mojor; Hungarian Rhapsody No. 2; Sonata in B Minor and Les Preludes. Particular attention is given to the latter piece as an example of the symphonic poem.
